title: Bowled over: YES Network to televise seven Major League Cricket matches after World Cup buzz
body:
Cricket batters will join Yankee sluggers on YES next month.

The broadcast home of the Bronx Bombers has inked a deal with on-demand streaming platform Willow by Cricbuzz to televise Major League Cricket, the companies announced.

Jumping on the popularity of the ongoing Cricket World Cup, which played some group-stage matches on Long Island, YES will carry seven contests featuring defending MLC champion MI New York during their upcoming season.

YES subscribers can catch matches starting with the July 5 season-opener — which pits MI New York against the 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas, beginning at 3:30 pm ET.

“The recent triumph of the US cricket team over Pakistan in the ICC T20 World Cup has ignited a nationwide cricket frenzy,” said Todd Myers, chief operating officer of Willow by Cricbuzz.

Yes Network CEO Jon Litner added: “As sports fans around the world currently enjoy the ICC T20 World Cup, YES is delighted to partner with Willow by Cricbuzz to capitalize on the growing interest in the sport of cricket in the New York area by showcasing MI New York to sports fans throughout our territory.”

MI New York is playing its matches in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Morrisville, NC, while it seeks to build a permanent stadium in Marine Park, Brooklyn.

Below is MI New York’s full schedule on YES:

title: Willow by Cricbuzz strikes deal with YES Network for MLC matches
body:
Synopsis

The YES Network has partnered with Willow by Cricbuzz to broadcast seven Major League Cricket matches featuring defending champion MI New York on YES television and app, as well as Willow's TV network and streaming platform. The move aims to capitalise on the growing cricket interest in the U.S. The broadcast will start with the July 5 season-opener between MI New York and Seattle Orcas.

USA's leading regional sports network, YES Network, has struck a media partnership with Willow by Cricbuzz to air seven matches featuring the defending MLC champion, MI New York, this upcoming Major League Cricket (MLC) season.

These matches will be available on both the YES television network and the YES App, as well as on Willow by Cricbuzz’s TV network and its streaming platform.

This partnership will bring MLC action to YES’ coverage territory of New York State, Connecticut, northeastern Pennsylvania, and north and central New Jersey, starting with the July 5 season-opener pitting MI New York against the 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas.

“The recent triumph of the U.S. cricket team over Pakistan in the ICC T20 World Cup has ignited a nationwide cricket frenzy,” stated Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz.

RECOMMENDEDSTORIES FOR YOU

“In a strategic move to leverage this surge in interest, Willow by Cricbuzz and the YES Network have joined forces. This alliance will not only showcase the MLC and MI New York on a grand scale but also enhance the sport's visibility and accessibility. This transformative collaboration is poised to propel cricket’s skyrocketing popularity across the U.S. and invigorate a thriving fan base.”

“We are excited to welcome Major League Cricket and defending champion MI New York to the YES Network,” said Jon Litner, CEO, YES Network.

“As sports fans around the world currently enjoy the ICC T20 World Cup, YES is delighted to partner with Willow by Cricbuzz to capitalise on the growing interest in the sport of cricket in the New York area by showcasing MI New York to sports fans throughout our territory.”

title: Corey Anderson breaks record, signs three-year deal with MLC, and joins Hobart Hurricanes
body:
Corey Anderson is a hard-hitting left-handed all-rounder who can also bowl at a medium pace. He made his international debut in 2013 and broke Shahid Afridi’s record for the fastest hundred in ODIs in 2014. In 2020, Anderson left New Zealand to pursue a career in the USA, signing a three-year deal with Major League Cricket. He played Minor League Cricket starting in 2021 and made his BL debut for the Hobart Hurricanes in 2023, becoming eligible to represent the USA that same year. Anderson’s wife, Mary Margaret, is from Dallas, Texas.

COREY ANDERSON BIOGRAPHY

COREY ANDERSON’S NEWS

COREY ANDERSON’S BIO

Corey Anderson is a hard-hitting left-handed all-rounder who can also bowl at a medium pace. At just 16 years old, he became the youngest New Zealander to earn a professional contract. In only his second Test, Anderson scored a brilliant, stroke-filled hundred, though it was not enough to secure victory as the match ended in a draw against Bangladesh. Anderson announced his arrival on the world stage by breaking Shahid Afridi’s record for the fastest hundred in ODIs, achieving the feat in just 36 balls against the West Indies in Queenstown. The knock included six fours and 14 sixes, a record that had stood for 17 years. In 2020, Corey Anderson left New Zealand to pursue a career in the USA, signing a three-year deal with Major League Cricket. He played Minor League Cricket starting in 2021 and made his BL debut for the Hobart Hurricanes in 2023, becoming eligible to represent the USA that same year.

COREY ANDERSON RECORDS

Second Fastest Century in ODI’s – 35 balls

DEBUT IN INTERNATIONAL CRICKET

Test– October 09 – 13, 2013 vs Bangladesh at Chattogram

ODI– June 16, 2013 vs England at Cardiff

T20I– December 21, 2012, vs South Africa at Durban

CRICKET & MORE

Domestic/ IPL Teams- New Zealand, New Zealand U19, New Zealand A, Mumbai Indians, Guyana Amazon Warriors, Northern Knights, Delhi Capitals, Somerset, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Lahore Qalandars, Edinburgh Rocks, Auckland, Team Abu Dhabi, Barbados

Royals, World Giants, Manipal Tigers, San Francisco Unicorns, Morrisville Unity, Hobart Hurricanes, MI Emirates, United States

COREY ANDERSON’S VIDEO

COREY ANDERSON WIFE

Anderson’s wife, Mary Margaret, is from Dallas, Texas. He moved from Auckland to Dallas in 2020.

GALLERY

title: TAK, aby transmitować w telewizji siedem meczów Major League Cricket
body:
Home Rozrywka TAK, aby transmitować w telewizji siedem meczów Major League Cricket

Rozrywka

TAK, aby transmitować w telewizji siedem meczów Major League Cricket

By

Rafał Jędrzejczyk

-

11

Pałkarze krykieta dołączą do Yankee sluggers w programie YES w przyszłym miesiącu.

Stacja transmisyjna drużyny Bronx Bombers podpisała umowę z platformą transmisji strumieniowej na żądanie Willow by Cricbuzz na transmisję telewizyjną Major League Cricket, ogłosiły firmy.

Czerpiąc z popularności trwających Pucharu Świata w Krykiecie, podczas którego na Long Island rozgrywane były mecze pierwszej rundy, YES zorganizuje w nadchodzącym sezonie siedem konkursów z udziałem broniącego tytułu mistrza MLC MI New York.

Abonenci YES mogą oglądać mecze począwszy od meczu otwierającego sezon 5 lipca, w którym MI New York zmierzy się z wicemistrzem roku 2023 Seattle Orcas, zaczynając od 15:30 ET.

„ niedawny triumf amerykańskiej drużyny krykieta nad Pakistanem w Pucharze Świata ICC T20 wywołał ogólnokrajowy szał krykieta” – powiedział Todd Myers, dyrektor operacyjny Willow by Cricbuzz.

Dyrektor generalny Yes Network, Jon Litner, dodał: „Ponieważ fani sportu na całym świecie cieszą się obecnie Pucharem Świata ICC T20, firma YES jest zachwycona współpracą z Willow by Cricbuzz, aby wykorzystać rosnące zainteresowanie sportem krykieta w rejonie Nowego Jorku poprzez prezentację MI Nowy Jork fanom sportu na całym naszym terytorium.”

MI New York rozgrywa swoje mecze w Grand Prairie w Teksasie i Morrisville w Karolinie Północnej, a jednocześnie stara się zbudować stały stadion w Marine Park na Brooklynie.

Poniżej pełny harmonogram MI New York na YES:

Piątek, 5 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra Seattle Orcas 15:30 czasu wschodniego*

Sobota, 6 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra Washington Freedom 15:00 czasu wschodniego*

Piątek, 12 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra Texas Super Kings 15:00 czasu wschodniego*

Niedziela, 14 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra Texas Super Kings 20:30 czasu wschodniego

wtorek, 16 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra Washington Freedom 20:30 czasu wschodniego

Czwartek, 18 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra San Francisco Unicorns 20:30 czasu wschodniego

Niedziela, 21 lipca MI Nowy Jork kontra Los Angeles Knight Riders 20:30 czasu wschodniego

title: Cricket In Usa Latest News, Cricket In Usa Breaking News Live
body:
Never thought we'd be playing cricket in the US: Kohli labels T20 WC 'start of domino effect'

Cricket | Jun 01, 2024, 05:29 PM IST

The T20 World Cup 2024 is set to open the game to a whole new audience in the United States with the country being the co-host of the marquee event. Virat Kohli, one of the biggest crowd-pullers, visited the US Consulate in Mumbai before leaving for the tournament and spoke on playing cricket in US.

USA's Major League Cricket gets official List-A status by ICC ahead of 2nd edition

Cricket | Jun 01, 2024, 04:29 PM IST

Major League Cricket (MLC) ahead of its second edition has officially received the List-A status. The success of the inaugural season in Texas and Morrisville and the involvement of some of the biggest T20 stars kept the tournament in good stead and now the official T20 status is cherry on the top.

title: Corey Anderson to captain San Francisco Unicorns for upcoming Major League Cricket season
body:
Corey Anderson will follow his commitments with the USA national team at the ongoing ICC Men’s T20 World Cup with the San Francisco Unicorns captaincy role for the second Major League Cricket (MLC) season

Domestic star Anderson is taking part in his second season with the Unicorns, having finished the team’s top scorer in 2023.

Tickets for all matches are available now at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com.

The San Francisco Unicorns has today announced that batting all-rounder and USA international Corey Anderson will captain the side for the second season of Major League Cricket.

Anderson, 33, has established himself as a key figure in the Unicorns’ locker room since being drafted for the inaugural 2023 MLC season, in which he finished as the team’s top run scorer with an impressive average of 47.50, while also providing economical bowling support.

Currently on duty with the USA international team at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, Anderson was part of one of the biggest shocks in cricket history as the hosts beat previous finalists Pakistan after a thrilling Super Over to record back-to-back opening victories.

Commenting on his appointment as captain of the San Francisco Unicorns, Anderson said: “It’s an honor to take the mantle of Unicorns’ captain and lead out a team packed full of talent, including our latest signing Pat Cummins. He brings a wealth of expertise to the group, and I’m looking forward to leaning on him as a mentor when it comes to game strategy and leadership.”

“After experiencing the inaugural MLC season, I have high expectations for 2024 both on and off the pitch, and will be fully focused on delivering success to the growing Unicorns fanbase – once I’ve done all I can to take the USA as far as I can in the current T20 World Cup.”

The former multi-format representative for New Zealand has made a name for himself with a powerful striking style that once saw Anderson hold the record for fastest ODI hundred in just 36 balls. He has since gone on to earn 38 International T20 caps, averaging 26.41 with a strike rate over 130, and represent various T20 franchises including the IPL’s Royal Challengers Bangalore and Big Bash League’s Hobart Hurricanes.

Shane Watson, Head Coach of the San Francisco Unicorns, added: “Corey has been pivotal in shaping this franchise’s DNA since the inaugural season last year. He is a natural leader on and off the field and has an immense amount of experience at the highest level, which translates perfectly into leading the San Francisco Unicorn’s this season.

“I am super excited about building a very successful coach-captain relationship with him.”

Pat Cummins, Australia Test and ODI Captain and recent Unicorns signing, said: “The culture of the Unicorns group, put into place by the likes of Corey and Shane, is one of the reasons why I’m here. As a USA international and fan favorite, he’s a deserving captain and I can’t wait to play for him and the rest of the team in July.”

Corey Anderson will lead the Unicorns out in his first match as captain against the LA Knight Riders on July 7, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium, near Dallas, TX – the same venue that saw USA edge out Pakistan – featuring a team packed full of global superstars, including recent signing Pat Cummins, NZ batter Finn Allen, and Pakistani pace bowler Haris Rauf.
